circumstances: While on a night ILS approach to Alpena-County-Phelps-Collins Airport, the pilot encountered marginal weather conditions and failed to realize his altitude was too low. On short final, the twin engine airplane struck the ground and crashed 1,6 mile short of runway 36. The airplane was destroyed upon impact and all three occupants were killed.
probable_cause:
Controlled collision with ground on final approach due to improper IFR operation on part of the pilot. The following contributing factors were reported: 
- Low ceiling, 
- Rain,
- Fog,
- Weather conditions slightly worse than forecast, 
- Visibility 2 miles or less.
